Sagittal split ramus osteotomy and vertical ramus osteotomy are both common procedures used in orthognathic surgery to correct mandibular deformities. Subapical osteotomy is less common but may be used in certain cases.

The most suitable option for a >10 mm setback of the mandible would likely involve one or more of these procedures, possibly including extraction of premolars.
